sentences.cn: “ 我是说福林特的东西还在吗?”他叫道.
“ 伊斯利尔以前是福林特的炮手.”格雷粗声粗气地说.
“ 是福林特, 我的 —— ”麦利失声惊叫道.

sentences.en: 'Now, Jim, you tell me true: that ain't Flint's ship?'
sentences.cn: “ 吉姆, 你现在给我说实话,那是不是福林特的船? ”

sentences.en: Ah, he was the man to have a headpiece, was Flint!
sentences.cn: 啊, 福林特可真是个有头脑的人!

sentences.en: At that time they had learned to strike fire from flint.
sentences.cn: 那时他们已学会了用燧石打火.

sentences.en: Flint was, and he died of rum at Savannah.
sentences.cn: 福林特也是那种人, 结果在萨瓦纳为朗姆酒送了命.

sentences.en: He has a heart as hard as flint.
His eyes were as hard as flint.
One can strike out sparks from flint with steel.
sentences.cn: 用钢敲打火石,可以打出火花.
这是福林特船长—— 希尔弗 的绿色鹦鹉!

sentences.en: That would have been Flint's or Billy Bones's.'
sentences.cn: 那是福林特和比尔-本斯的做法. ”

sentences.en: The rock here was as hard as flint.
sentences.cn: 这里的岩石像燧石一样坚硬.

sentences.en: This layer of rock contains a lot of flint.
sentences.cn: 这一岩层中有大量燧石.

sentences.en: Under the pressure, the flint crumbled into fragments.
sentences.cn: 燧石在压力的作用下碎成了小块。

words.tran_cn: 坚硬的；燧石似的；坚定不移的
燧石；[岩]打火石；极硬的东西

trans.tran_cn: 燧石，火石，（打火机等的）打火石
trans.tran_en: a type of smooth hard stone that makes a small flame when you hit it with steel
